questions.question: 1. The trucking industry is subject to regulations from which of the following agencies?
answers: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement (BSEE)

questions.question: 2. The Federal Motor Carrier Safety Regulations (FMCSRs) establish basic safety rules and standards for:
answers: drivers and other employees of motor carriers
all answers are correct, except tolls
questions.correctAnswer: all answers are correct, except tolls

questions.question: 3. In order to obtain your commercial driver's license (CDL), you must first:
answers: Have all restrictions removed from your personal driver's license
Get an endorsement for passenger carrying vehicles

questions.question: 4. Which of the following requires an endorsement on your CDL?
5. According to the FMCSRs, you are qualified to operate a CMV if you:
answers: Are currently disqualified from operating a motor vehicle

questions.question: 6. Which of the following is considered a major disqualifying offense?
answers: Leaving the scene of an accident
Following the vehicle ahead too closely
questions.correctAnswer: Leaving the scene of an accident

questions.question: 7. Prohibited alcohol use includes which of the following?
answers: Use during the eight hours following an accident, or until you undergo a post-accident test
Use during the eight hours before performing safety sensitive-functions
Reporting for duty with an alcohol concentration of 0.01 or greater
Use while cleaning your windows and mirrors
questions.correctAnswer: Use during the eight hours following an accident, or until you undergo a post-accident test

questions.question: 8. Which of the following will result in you being removed from all safety-sensitive functions until you go through a return-to-duty process?
answers: Refusing to take a required alcohol and/or drug test
